item.title: 1 error! WTF?!?
item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

you have to do this:

PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "Owner Duck has just logged in!";

not

Playerhandler.messageToAll("Owner Duck has just logged in!"); [br][size=1]Posted on: June 29, 2007, 11:26:40 AM[/size][hr]btw, just to explain, your way doenst work because you are stating it as a void but actually you are supposed to change what the String messageToAll holds

Read full topic

item.title: 1 error! WTF?!?
item.dc:creator: @bmxr4c3r709 bmxr4c3r709
item.description:
@bmxr4c3r709 wrote:

I just added this cause I was bored…

if(playerRights == 3) { sendMessage("Welcome back owner "+playerName); PlayerHandler.messageToAll("Owner Duck has just logged in!"); sendMessage("Welcome to Duckscape"); }

Then I get this error…

client.java:15439: cannot find symbol symbol : method messageToAll(java.lang.String) location: class PlayerHandler PlayerHandler.messageToAll("Owner Duck has just logged in!"); ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic
